entry.title: Is there a BAPI/Tool/method for assigning already stored file in SAP Content Server to a new DMS DIR
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

BAPI or Tool or method for assigning already stored file in SAP Content Server to a new or existing DMS DIR
Join DIR <--> Physical ID and Logic ID ( of existing content server)
We want to copy a SAP content server from acquisition and connect to our current SAP system and create a new DIR and link the content server file to this new DIR ( we do not wish to download and upload the physical file as the QTY is very high )

Is there a BAPI or Tool or method for assigning already stored file in SAP Content Server to a new or existing DMS DIR We looked into few BAPIs : BAPI_DOCUMENT_CHANGE2

But how do we link DIR to Physical ID and Logical ID from existing content server

Or

SCMS_DOC_CREATE_FILES or SCMS_DOC_UPDATE
This has Physical ID and Logic ID but no way to connect to DIR

Or

CVAPI_DOC_CHECKIN or CVAPI_DOC_MASS_MAINTAIN -- has DIR and Physical ID and Logic ID but which is the correct BAPI link new DIR to for existing content server file ?


How do I link the NEW DIR to join the below table so that it connects to existing SAP Content server file After this it s DMS_PHF_CD1 DMS_PH_CD1 DMS_DOC2LOIO DMS_PHIO2FILE



So that when user click original in CV03N ‚Äì it points to existing SAP content server file

Your help in this matter would be much appreciated.

Regards,

Pradeep Bojja

entry.title: Re: Add Custom Context Attributes for SAP Released Event Types
entry.content:
Hello Mateusz,

unfortunately as you said, this special event is not extensible in OP. but it is just an example, if you find an extensible event then you can do the metadata extension as it is explained here.  

regarding I_BUSINESSPARTNERTP_2, as you can see there is no parameter view defined here to check the extensibility. 

in total, the criteria must be met.

Regards

Safa

entry.title: Re: Incorrect time in time zone setting
entry.content:
Hi All,

You have to check time and time zone in OS (Windows, linux, ...) of the App server and Database server

In the above case, the database time is earlier by about 5 minutes (increasing time of database server can be done without App stopping, while decreasing time on database server require App stop then start again after time decrease)

Of course to change time or time zone it will depends on OS itself, in windows you can do from "control panel"   in linux you can do with "date" command. Also in SUSE linux specially you can use "yast"

entry.content:
Hello guys,
we have implemented BADI: /SCWM/EX_CORE_PTS_NBIN_NRM To allow mixed storage for same product but with different batches because we don't receive by HU 
but the problem is in the standard behavior if the quantity exceeds bin capacity it does split automatically and distribute the quantity when i allow split in the storage type
but when we implement the Badi splitting doesn't happen any more 
can anyone help?

entry.title: Future Proof Microsoft Outlook Integration for SAP Sales Cloud with Microsoft Graph
entry.content:
To keep your sales team operating at peak efficiency, the tools they use must be reliable and future-proof. That's why we made migrating your SAP Sales Cloud's Server-Side Groupware Integration to leverage modern Microsoft Graph APIs a simple but important step to take. This isn't just about maintaining continuity; it's about enhancing security, improving reliability, and aligning with Microsoft's direction. Let's explore how this straightforward update can protect your sales operations from disruption.

The 5-Step Migration Process from EWS to Graph API

Now for the practical part. The good news is that we have made this migration process manageable. The core strategy isn't about changing your existing setup in-place, but rather creating a new, correctly configured Organization within Groupware and then moving your users into it. This approach minimizes risk and ensures a clean, controlled transition. Here is the step-by-step process to migrate your users, just like our official documentation describes it:

Step 1: Log in and Navigate to Organizations

First, log in to your SAP Sales Cloud V2 system with administrative privileges. From the main dashboard, navigate to the Groupware settings by going to:

Settings > Groupware > Organizations

This is the central hub where you manage how different groups of users connect to their email servers.

Step 2: Create a New Organization

Click to create a new organization. This will serve as the new home for all users connecting via the Microsoft Graph API. Give it a clear, descriptive name (e.g., "Microsoft Graph Users" or "M365 Graph Sync") to avoid confusion, and then save it.

Step 3: Configure the Mailbox for Graph API

This is the most crucial step. Select the new organization you just created. Within its settings, find the Email Configuration tab. Here, you must change the Mailbox Access Type from the default or EWS setting to the required option for Microsoft Graph APIs. This tells SAP Sales Cloud to use the modern authentication and API methods for this specific organization.

Step 4: Move Users to the New Organization

With your new Graph API-enabled organization ready, it's time to move the users over from the old EWS-based organization. SAP provides two flexible methods for this:

  • Bulk Move: Navigate to the main Users List in the Groupware section. From here, you can select multiple (or all) users at once and move them to the new organization. This is the most efficient method for migrating everyone.

  • Individual Move: If you prefer a phased rollout or need to move specific users one by one, you can go into each user's User Details Page and reassign them to the new organization individually.

Step 5: Verify and Decommission

Once users have been moved, their groupware sync will begin using the new Microsoft Graph API connection. It is highly recommended to test with a pilot user or group to confirm that emails, appointments, and contacts are synchronizing correctly. After you have successfully migrated all users and confirmed functionality, you can safely decommission the old EWS-based organization to complete the process.

Finalizing the Switch: The Key to Unlocking the Benefits

By following these steps, you're not just performing a technical update; you're actively future-proofing your sales team's most critical integration. However, remember there is one final, user-driven step to lock in these benefits. The migration is only finalized once each user re-authenticates their connection.

After being moved to the new organization, each user must navigate to Groupware User Settings > My Sync Status > Email Configuration and update their settings. This action will trigger a one-time consent request from Microsoft. Once they grant consent, their synchronization will officially and permanently switch to the more secure, reliable, and modern Microsoft Graph API. This final handshake ensures every member of your team is transitioned smoothly, securing your data flow and delivering the seamless operational continuity that is vital for sales success.

entry.title: General Task List Approval Process
entry.content:
Hello,

I need help with a specific topic. A customer wants to implement an approval process for general task lists.

They do not want the process to proceed when a general task list is created or changed without manager approval.

The idea is to create a custom Z-table to store the information temporarily, and once approval is given, use the appropriate BAPI ‚Äî either EAM_TASKLIST_CREATE or EAM_TASKLIST_CHANGE depending on the task ‚Äî to proceed with the process in alignment with the approval flow.

However, my main issue is that some of these general task lists are linked to calibrations, and I couldn‚Äôt find a suitable BAPI for this part. Could you help me with this? Is there any BAPI available to handle MIC (Master Inspection Characteristic) linkage for Type A general task lists?

I considered using a BDC, but I‚Äôm not sure if a BAPI and BDC can be executed in sequence reliably. Also, this is not a one-time upload or update ‚Äî it‚Äôs an ongoing process. That‚Äôs why I don‚Äôt think BDC would be an effective solution, as it can easily fail if the data deviates even slightly from the expected format.

I would appreciate your support.

Best Regard

entry.title: ABAP unit test coverage not work for CONSTRUCTOR
entry.content:
There is some logic in CONSTRUTOR method of my class, So I wrote some unit test for creating instance

1. The unit tests all passed successful, no dump

2. Debugging for the UT can run into break-point of CONSTRUCTOR method.

3. Other instance method UT coverage works good.

the problem is , the UT coverage of CONSTRUTOR method always 0%, anyone met this problem?

UT code like:

CLASS ltd_test DEFINITION FOR TESTING
  DURATION SHORT
  RISK LEVEL HARMLESS
  INHERITING FROM zcl_data.
  PRIVATE SECTION.

    DATA: mo_tool_double TYPE REF TO zif_data_tool.

    METHODS: setup

    METHODS: constructor_test FOR TESTING.

ENDCLASS.

CLASS ltd_test IMPLEMENTATION.

  METHOD setup.
    mo_tool_double ?= cl_abap_testdouble=>create( 'zif_data_tool' ).

  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD constructor_test .
    cl_abap_testdouble=>configure_call( mo_tool_double )->ignore_all_parameters( )->and_expect( )->is_called_once( ).
    mo_tool_double->get_data(  ).

    DATA lo_c TYPE REF TO zcl_data.

    CREATE OBJECT lo_c 
          EXPORTING io_double = mo_tool_double.


    cl_abap_testdouble=>verify_expectations( mo_tool_double ).
  ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.

entry.title: Re: Digital Signature reporting in SolDoc
entry.content:
There is no such report and no new development for that. Since solution manager will reach end of mainstream maintenance in 2027. (See SAPnote:3255311) In line with this decision, we are focusing on maintaining the stability and reliability of the current version rather than introducing new features.

Maybe you can go to the List View and display only Documents and filter with the status after the first signature was done and the document type. At least in that way you can see a list of the documents which need to be signed, although you cannot see if one specific person has to sign.

entry.title: Withholding tax for customer invoice in Italy #COE#RFL01
entry.content:
Hello,

I work for an Italian company that already have withholding tax for supplier invoice. But recently they have been asking to manage withholding for customer invoices.

I checked the SCCUI but I didn‚Äôt have access to SCCUI 104408 who make links between a condition type and the withholding type.

After checking document ‚ÄúSSCUI_List_EN_XX.xlsm‚Äù, I can see that SCCUI 104408 is not available for Italy.

So, I deduce that SAP is not compliant with withholding tax for customer invoice in Italy.

But as it is a legal obligation, I think there are some workarounds.

Have you some information or feedback about that?

Yours sincerely,

Teddy.

#COE#RFL01

entry.title: Re: advanced ATP for third party sales orders
entry.content:
Thanks for the reply and I have checked the help before setting it up, but it is not working for me. The help text is stating:

The CB1 or CBAB subitem always results in a full confirmation in the availability check if the source of supply is valid for the requested date and quantity. With the confirmation, the system generates the required purchase requisitions for the supplier. If no source can be found for a determined material-plant combination, the availability check results in a zero confirmation and the item category remains TAN.

This means for me that the product master setting for the material is not a third party setting, otherwise the item category will not be TAN. If this is the case than the scenario is not working for my customer. Can you confirm my thoughts?

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud ALM(Health Monitoring):Number of User
entry.content:
Dear CustomerÔºå

 

Thanks for your patience.

"Number of Users" metric under HM indicates the Total number of currently active user sessions in the system.

I'm checked internally for the "UserType" info under Health Monitoring:

  • Dialog‚ÜíGUI in AL08
  • RFC‚ÜíRFC in AL08
  • CONCUR‚Üí user count after remove the duplicates. 
    This should not be calculated to the "Number of Users". see details under KBA 3522884 



Please feel free to let me know when further inquiries.

 

Best Regards,

Sunny

entry.title: Pricing - Condition activate with requirements
entry.content: I wrote a requirement on pricing to activate or deactivate a price condition. At the moment when the requirement sets the sy-subrc = 0, the condition does not trigger automatically and a repricing is needed. How can I resolve this? All of this in the sales order.

entry.title: Re: Error when trying to delete fs item
entry.content: we got support from SAP to solve this one. On our current code level only role IDs are stored in tables TF692, TF602, TF696 and TF140. However, in earlier versions (which we started on originally), fs item IDs were stored. After the update, these fs item IDs are still in the tables but are not updated anymore.

entry.title: Re: We cannot assign separate number ranges to different...
entry.content: I believe the BAdI depends on billing document header data where plant wont be there and hence, the issue. What you can try is consider using CPF to define flexible number range logic. CPF allows you to evaluate fields like Company Code, Sales Org and you expose plant as a custom field via extensibility.

entry.title: Issue with Missing Records in CDS Table Function (ABAP 7.50 / HANA)
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I‚Äôm hoping someone here can help me with a problem I‚Äôm facing.

I‚Äôve been asked to provide data for a report that should show the date of the last document for each customer. I planned to implement this using a CDS view. However, since we are still on ABAP release 7.50, I don‚Äôt have access to the latest CDS View features.

To work around this, I tried using a CDS Table Function to retrieve the data. Unfortunately, I noticed that some records are missing. When I run the same SELECT statement in the SQL Console, I get a result for a specific customer ‚Äì but that same record is not returned by the Table Function.

The data does exist in the underlying tables, so I‚Äôm wondering:
Why is the record not returned by the Table Function?

I‚Äôm aware that there are differences between Open SQL and SQLScript used in Table Functions, but I would have expected the Table Function to return at least the same or more data ‚Äì not less.

We are running ABAP 7.50 on a HANA database.

OpenSQL:

SQLScript:

‚ÄÉ

‚ÄÉ

Any ideas or explanations would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: BoE ‚Äì AP: Why Can‚Äôt We Set Maturity Date per Supplier Master ?
entry.content:
Dear expert, 

I‚Äôm reaching out to seek clarification regarding the handling of Bills of Exchange (BoE) due dates (maturity dates) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition).

Based on our testing and the SAP Knowledge Base Article [2837406 ‚Äì Due Date in Manage Automatic Payments for BOE Outgoing Payments], we understand that the BoE due date can either be manually entered during the automatic payment run or derived from the invoice due date, depending on the configuration setup shown in the KBA above. 

However, in our case, BoE maturity terms (e.g., 45, 60, or 90 days) are typically defined in individual supplier contracts and therefore differ from one vendor to another. As these terms are vendor-specific and contractually agreed, it would be both practical and efficient to maintain the BoE maturity term directly within the supplier master data. Doing so would enable the system to automatically apply the correct maturity during BoE processing, ensuring consistency and minimizing manual input.

Therefore, I would like to understand why SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition) does not currently support storing BoE maturity terms per supplier in the supplier master.

I kindly request your support in addressing the following:

  • Could you clarify why the system does not allow BoE maturity terms (e.g., 60 days) to be maintained per supplier?

  • Are there any planned enhancements in this area, or possible workarounds (such as using custom fields or extensibility features)?

  • What are the recommended best practices for handling BoE AP in scenarios where maturity terms are supplier-specific?

Your guidance on this matter would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards,
HY

entry.title: Re: CCM: Block condition contract after final settlement...
entry.content:
With Status Profile, you can achieve this.
Go to SPRO > Logistics - General > Settlement Management > Condition Contract Management > Condition Contract Maintenance > Define Condition Contract Types.  Assign a Status Profile that includes a status like ‚ÄúFinal Settled‚Äù or ‚ÄúLocked‚Äù. Configure the status to restrict further processing (e.g., prevent changes or new settlements)

entry.title: SAC Advanced Formula Iterative Prioritization
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I need some suggestion and perspective advise on below calculation logic.

We have some car plate codes ( VLK_PRJ ) and each plate code has relavant customer code assigned in its masterdata as well as contract starting date. As the first step, I generate mapping combination with VLK_PRJ, Date ( Contract starting date ), and relavant customer code ( VLK_CUS ) and entrytype ( VLK_ETYPE ) as I_MAPPING which means mapping coming from integration.

Then, those values are shown to users, and they might enter some adjustments for customer assignments ( assuming the car will be given service to another customer in the future ). I keep those entries with entrytype A_MAPPING ( adjusted mapping ).

What I want to achieve is creating C_MAPPING records ( calculated mapping ) starting from the contract starting date until the end of planning date coming from version attribute. For this calculation I have below rules. Also, I have 21 customer in masterdata, and around 450 plate codes.

  1. If both A_MAPPING and I_MAPPING exists with the same combination of VLK_PRJ and Date, then I_MAPPING is ignored.
  2. If multiple combinations are entered for the same combination of VLK_PRJ and date, then the first customer code will be used, rest will not be considered. ( I know this might be handled from input screen, but let's assume user entered multiple combination by mistake )
  3. If there is no mapping entry for the further periods ( I_MAPPING only exists for the starting date, and no A_MAPPING is entered for the next period ), then duplicate it from preivous period as it is.

Please find below script which works as expected but it takes more than 3 mins which is too long I believe. I have 3 blocks of calculations, improvements or different approach for any part is appreciated.

CONFIG.GENERATE_UNBOOKED_DATA = OFF

MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = "SDATA"
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/START] TO [d/Version].[p/END]
MEMBERSET [d/VLK_ETYPE] = ("A_MAPPING", "C_MAPPING", "I_MAPPING")
MEMBERSET [d/VLK_PRJ] = BASEMEMBER([d/VLK_PRJ], "PLAKA_AKTIF")

AGGREGATE_DIMENSIONS = [d/VLK_DET], [d/VLK_PCTR]
AGGREGATE_WRITETO [d/VLK_DET] = "#"
AGGREGATE_WRITETO [d/VLK_PCTR] = "#"

VARIABLEMEMBER #MAPPING_FLAG OF [d/VLK_ETYPE]

INTEGER @LV_CHECK
INTEGER @LV_COUNTER
INTEGER @i
INTEGER @LV_PREV_MONTH

DELETE([d/VLK_ETYPE] = "C_MAPPING") //clear previously calculated mapping

IF [d/VLK_ETYPE] = "A_MAPPING" THEN //mapping adjustments
	FOREACH.BOOKED [d/VLK_PRJ], [d/Date]
		FOREACH.BOOKED [d/VLK_CUS] ASC
			DATA([d/VLK_ETYPE] = "C_MAPPING") = RESULTLOOKUP() //only apply the first customer if multiple adjustments are entered for the same project time combination
			BREAK //do not proceed further
		ENDFOR
	ENDFOR

ENDIF

IF [d/VLK_ETYPE] = "I_MAPPING" THEN // mapping values coming from integration
	FOREACH.BOOKED [d/VLK_PRJ], [d/Date]

		@LV_CHECK = 0 // not sure if necessary ?
		@LV_CHECK = RESULTLOOKUP([d/VLK_ETYPE] = "A_MAPPING") // check if there is an adjustment entry
		IF @LV_CHECK = 0 THEN // if there is no adjustment entry
			DATA([d/VLK_ETYPE] = "C_MAPPING") = RESULTLOOKUP() // get whatever is coming from integration ( only 1 customer mapping is coming already from integration )
		ENDIF
	ENDFOR
ENDIF

IF [d/VLK_ETYPE] = "C_MAPPING" THEN // output mapping entrytype
	FOREACH.BOOKED [d/VLK_PRJ], [d/Date] ASC //start from the first month of mapping entry of the project
		
		// if no mapping is processed before, process further.
		IF RESULTLOOKUP([d/VLK_ETYPE] = #MAPPING_FLAG, [d/Date] = "000000", [d/VLK_CUS] = "#") = NULL THEN 
			DATA([d/VLK_ETYPE] = #MAPPING_FLAG, [d/Date] = "000000", [d/VLK_CUS] = "#") = 1 // flag mapping as processed for the project

			@LV_COUNTER = DATEDIFF([d/Date], [d/Version].[p/END], "MONTH")
			IF @LV_COUNTER > 0 THEN //check if not at the last month already
				FOR @I = 1 TO @LV_COUNTER  // start from the next month
					@LV_CHECK = 0 // not sure if necessary ?
					@LV_CHECK = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Date] = NEXT(@I, "MONTH", [d/Date])) // check if there is mapping entry for the next month
					IF @LV_CHECK = 0 THEN //if there is no mapping for the next month, get it from previous month
						
						@LV_PREV_MONTH = @I - 1
						DATA([d/Date] = NEXT(@I, "MONTH", [d/Date])) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Date] = NEXT(@LV_PREV_MONTH, "MONTH", [d/Date]))

					ENDIF
				ENDFOR
			ENDIF
		ENDIF
	ENDFOR
ENDIF

Thanks,

Volkan

entry.title: Re: Problem at task TS00300058 in the workflow WS00300022.
entry.content: Although it's an ancient post, I had the same issue, and I like to provide a more precise answer. My result is that the task TS00300058 is defined as a background task, whereas the method STATUSCHANGE uses the FM AIA1_REQUEST_STATUS_CHANGE, which attempts to call screens in the background. This results in dumps to program SAPMSSY1 with exception DYNPRO_NOT_FOUND, which initially makes it unclear in ST22 where the error occurred. A deeper look is necessary.

entry.title: Re: How can we know the number of customer invoices sent...
entry.content:
You need to develop a custom report considering tables like VBRK, NAST, ADR6 & VBPA.


Filter logic should be based on

  1. the Partner Function to ZM in VBPA
  2. billing date from VBRK for the specific year
  3. email address from ADR6 table
  4. Output type (ex.medium = 5 for email) and Status = Successfully processed from NAST.  The status would be helpful to exclude failed emails

entry.title: Re: Pricing - Condition activate with requirements
entry.content:
Your custom routine is not working because, during repricing either in sales order or billing, SAP re-evaluates pricing conditions but Requirement routines may not re-trigger unless explicitly coded to do so. KZWIx may not be populated yet when the requirement runs or z002 might not be active or calculated at the time when z001's requirement is evaluated.

What you can do is assign the custom routine to z001 (if not already done). This should check if z002 is present in xkomv. Compare its value to komp-kzwi3. Returns TRUE only if z002 > kzwi3.

Additionally, in your pricing procedure, z002 should be placed before z001 so its value is available. Use Subtotal column for z002 to store its value in KZWI3

entry.title: Re: Datasphere - Association to a dimension with input pa...
entry.content:
How to solve "Parameter cannot be added" error:
* Delete all upstream associations,
* Add parameter in affected table and use it
* Re-create all upstream associations

entry.title: Re: Derived Events- How to Trigger Custom Event from an SAP Standard Event
entry.content:
Hello @LakshmiHari 

Unfortunately, the APIs in OP and Cloud are not the same. you need to check the interface in your system to see if the statement 'use event change' exist there or not. if not, then creating the derived event is not possible because the content that is required on the interfaces simply does not exists. 

Only option here is to create a customer influence request and waiting that it will be implemented (which takes time).

Best regards

Safa

entry.title: Re: Best Practice - SAP EarlyWatch Alert
entry.content:
Hi @Michael_Hoppe 
thanks for having a look at my issue.  That's exactly what I found out yesterday evening after some more investigation.
Problem was caused by our solution manager üôÑ:  It was caused by a blocked lock entry  in SM12, which was caused by a process cancellation during  job /BDL/TASK_PROCESSOR on 03.07.25. SDCCN Task log showed "Enqeue for category failed" 

After old SM12 from /BDL/TASK_PROCESSOR was removed, /BDL/TASK_PROCESSOR could do its work and sent all reports to SAP. EWA Workspace has some new data now üôÇ.
Because the data from Rise Systems comes another way the data was there, while the other was missing

entry.title: Innovate globally with two new SAP Business Technology Platform regions on Amazon Web Services
entry.content:
Innovate globally with two new SAP Business Technology Platform regions on Amazon Web Services

 

We‚Äôre excited to announce that SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) is now available in the Amazon Web Services (AWS) region ‚ÄúUS West (Oregon)‚Äù and will be available on AWS in Milan later this year. This follows up on our announcement to further expand the regional availability of SAP BTP at the SAP TechEd conference in October 2024. In total, SAP BTP will be offered in 11 AWS regions globally.

Benefits

As part of SAP‚Äôs ongoing efforts to expand its data center footprint, we are enabling customers in more regions to innovate with SAP BTP. With this, there will be 2 SAP BTP regions available in the US (Virginia and Oregon) and in Europe (Frankfurt and Milan) on AWS infrastructure, which will also be enabled to act as cross region disaster recovery sites for HANA Cloud.

In addition, the expanded availability is especially beneficial for RISE with SAP customers. It offers additional options to select a SAP BTP region close to core business systems like S/4HANA.

And of course, SAP and AWS will continue to work on new joint innovations to benefit customers. For example, SAP‚Äôs Generative AI Hub allows you to access a variety of LLMs such as Amazon Bedrock models to streamline core business processes, all within a modern, intelligent, and collaborative user experience. SAP and AWS also launched a new AI Co-Innovation Program to help partners build generative artificial intelligence applications with SAP Generative AI Hub and Amazon Bedrock. Check out this announcement to learn more!

 

Scope & Timeline

SAP and AWS are targeting to deploy SAP BTP in the following two AWS Regions:

  • US West - Oregon, available as of now
  • Milan, to be available in H2/2025

You can also find the latest updates on planned timelines for new deployments in the SAP Roadmap Explorer.

A detailed overview about all SAP BTP services offered on AWS can be found on SAP Discovery Center.

 

SAP and AWS Partnership

Businesses have been running enterprise applications from SAP on AWS cloud infrastructure since 2008. SAP BTP, in conjunction with AWS, provides a simplified architectural approach to embrace a clean core by providing a framework for application development, integration and analytics as an integrated extension to the ERP core to drive benefits including accelerated migrations, business process automation and 360¬∞ analytics. Today, SAP operates in 35 AWS regions and manages thousands of AWS accounts. SAP is committed to providing its innovative technology to its customers around the globe. We look forward to working with AWS as a strategic partner to continue serving our joint customers. Learn more about our partnership here!

 

Learn More

Are you ready to embark on a digital transformation to improve organizational agility and resilience? Learn how SAP BTP and AWS can accelerate innovation and unlock business potential with enterprise-ready capabilities like application development, integration, data and analytics and AI. Check out SAP Discovery Center and implement your use cases on SAP BTP with step-by-step guidance and well established support from topic experts and the SAP community!

entry.title: Re: ABAP unit test coverage not work for CONSTRUCTOR
entry.content:
Nope. Could you provide a Minimal Reproducible Example that people can run and tell your ABAP version?

REPORT.
CLASS lcl_app DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    METHODS constructor.
    DATA a TYPE i.
ENDCLASS.
CLASS ltc_app DEFINITION FINAL
  FOR TESTING RISK LEVEL HARMLESS DURATION SHORT.
  PRIVATE SECTION.
    METHODS first_test FOR TESTING RAISING cx_static_check.
ENDCLASS.
CLASS lcl_app IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD constructor.
    IF sy-uzeit < '120000'.
      a = 1.
    ELSE.
      a = 2.
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.
CLASS ltc_app IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD first_test.
    DATA(app) = NEW lcl_app( ).
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

I had such a problem once ... if you date is interpreted as pure number 20250722 then max would work. If it is seen as 2025-07-22 then I think rank() would be needed. BR, Martin

entry.title: Re: Is there a standard query to get the conversion rates...
entry.content:
Hello @gunesbt ,

yes, there is a standard way, to solve this problem...

First you need an ODP source system for you own BW (here: "BWH") - not the regular BI system:

On this source system you create a custom Datasource which reads from BW table TCURR.

Then you include this Datasource in an Open ODS View.

In SAC, when you are in your Currency Table in SAC, you can directly use the Open ODS View as source for loading the data via the BW connection. 

For exceptional queries (TCURX), like e.g. CLP ... it might be that the value in SAC is not correct.

This needs probably a BW query, instead of the Open ODS view alone.

But what I summarize here is based on a word documentation of myself from 2020 üòâ ... so might be different today.

BR, Martin

entry.title: Re: Different behavior when submiting and calling transac...
entry.content:
VL10B calls program RVV50R10_PRESTEP, which in turn calls RVV50R10C. It skips the initial screen and uses predefined parameters or user profiles, whereas, program RVV50R10C displays the selection screen and processes deliveries based on input criteria. When run directly, it behaves like a standalone report.
Having said that, when you run the program, you get the full selection screen and can manually enter parameters. It doesn‚Äôt inherit the user role profile, default filters, or variant logic that VL10B applies automatically.

If you're seeing different delivery creation results, it's likely because VL10B applies filters or logic that aren't active when you run RVV50R10C directly. VL10B might exclude blocked orders or apply a specific delivery creation horizon, while RVV50R10C processes everything based on what you manually input.

entry.title: Sydney SAP Stammtisch 2508 (Greenwood Hotel)
entry.content:
The next #SAPStammtischSYD will be on Thursday 14th August at The Greenwood Hotel

This will be our first event at The Greenwood.  It's right on top of North Sydney Station, so super easy to get to

We'll be on the terrace from 5pm. Our reserved tables are under cover and heated so we will have a great event whatever the weather

Why not join us?

https://greenwoodhotel.com/

entry.title: No EP user in Integration Center Job Output
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are using EmpEmployment entity in Integration Center Job (no filter is used) to extract data .It has come to our attention that contractors are not being included in the output of the IC job.

For contractors, only basic user import is performed, and no other data is available for contractors. Kindly clarify whether it is anticipated behavior to omit contractors from this job's output, and if so, could you please explain the rationale behind this?

 

Best Regards.

entry.title: Re: MASS Change Scheduling Agreement Schedule: Delivery S...
entry.content:
Hi,

Unfortunately, we don't have any direct app or any standard way to update Purchase Order "Delivery Date" (POs Scheduling lines to different date) in mass.
As an alternative you can use BADI - MM_PUR_S4_PO_MODIFY_SCHEDULE to build own logic. See attached for details. 

Thanks 
Santosh Gangurde

entry.title: RAP Button action to navigate to external URL
entry.content:
Hi Guys,

We need to add a custom action BUTTON to navigate to an external URL in RAP list report.

Works Using column in list with annotation: type: #WITH_URL , but it's generates an hiperlink and the user wants a button

Question is how to achieve this external navigation on RAP simple as WITH_URL? ( im trying to avoid the creation of this action on frontend and navigation code on JS )
